conclusion: Analyze paths liquid will take from A, B, and C to containers D, E, or F.
Liquid from A flows down a white baffle.
Liquid from A encounters a black baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows down a yellow baffle.
Liquid from B encounters a blue baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows down a blue baffle.
Liquid from C encounters an orange baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Liquid from A and B will flow into container E; liquid from C will flow into container F.
